intro: Scutellaria integrifolia var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved blueweed, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and native plant gardens.
